intro: Scorzoneroides microcephala, commonly known as the small-headed scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often branched. The small, yellowish flowers are arranged in a dense cluster, and the plant produces small, oval-shaped fruits known as cypsela. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments.
